utterance.speaker: COMMERCIAL VOICEOVER
utterance.content: Can't get the monkey off your back? Then put it in your mouth...

utterance.speaker: COMMERCIAL VOICEOVER
utterance.content: ...With MonkeyShine Beer. MonkeyShine Beer, 'cause it's a jungle out there.]

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: That commercial always makes me so sad.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, but then the guy opens his beer and those girls run at him, so, everything seems to work out OK.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I meant because the monkey in it reminds me of Marcel.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I can see that, 'cause they both have those big brown eyes and, ya know, the little pouty chin.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: And the fact that they're both monkeys.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Sometimes I wonder if I did the right thing, ya know, giving him away.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, Ross, you had to, I mean, he was humping everything in sight. I mean, I have a Malibu Barbi that will no longer be wearing white to her wedding.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Remember when sometimes he'd borrow your hat, and, and when you got it back there'd be little monkey raisins in it.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah, well sure, when he did it, it was funny. When I did it to my boss's hat. . . all of the sudden I have this big attitude problem.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, hey, check it out, guess what I got.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Rhythm?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No, my first fan mail.

utterance.speaker: ALL
utterance.content: Alright!

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: 'Dear Dr. Remore, know that I love you and would do anything to have you.' Gosh. 'Your not-so-secretive admirer, Erica Ford.' Ooh wait, 'PS enclosed please find 14 of my eyelashes.'

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ya know, in crazy world, that means you're married.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: This wasn't addressed to Days of Our Lives, this is, this came to your apartment. There's no stamp on it, this woman was in our building.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh my god, I got my very own stalker.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey guys.

utterance.speaker: ALL
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ooh, where are you off to, Travelin' Jake?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, there's this, uh, paleontology conference in L.A. so I figured I'd go and then drive down to the zoo and surprise Marcel.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You know I think he will be surprised, 'till he realizes he's a monkey, and uh, you know, isn't capable of that emotion.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, Phoebe, that really cute guy is here again.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, oh, OK, so everyone, pretend like I'm telling you a story, OK. And, and it's really funny. So everyone just laugh, now.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I know, I know. Hello.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Hi. I'm Rob Dohnen.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hi Rob Dohnen.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: I don't know anything about music, but I think you're really, really great.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, wow.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Anyway, I schedule performers for the childrens libraries around the city and I was just thinking, have you ever thought about playing your songs for kids?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, I would love to have kids. . . you're, you're the, you're, me play the songs that I will write for them.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey, whaddya wanna do for dinner?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well we could just stay in and cook for ourselves.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: It's Erica.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ah, the stalker.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: Never mind, it's open.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yes, hitting her with a frying pan's a good idea. We might wanna have a backup plan, though, just in case she isn't a cartoon.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Let's get out of here.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: The one time they're not home.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: OK, we'll just leave, and when we pass her on the stairs, she won't know it's me 'cause we've never met.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: That's how radio stars escape stalkers.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: She's comin'.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: It's me.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Uhh, this is it, this is how we're gonna die. Ready?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Erica.

utterance.speaker: LIPSON
utterance.content: Hi, Dean Lipson, zoo administrator. I was told you had a question.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, I uh, I can't seem to find the monkey I donated last year. He's a capuchan, answers to the name Marcel.

utterance.speaker: LIPSON
utterance.content: Ahh, I'm afraid I have some bad news. Marcel has passed on.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh my God, what happened?

utterance.speaker: LIPSON
utterance.content: Well he got sick, and then he got sicker, and then he got a little better but then he died.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I can't believe this.

utterance.speaker: LIPSON
utterance.content: I'm sorry Mr. Geller. But ya know, there's an old saying, 'Sometimes monkeys die.' It's not a great saying but it certainly is fitting today.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, ya know, someone should have called me.

utterance.speaker: LIPSON
utterance.content: I'm sorry. Look, I know this can't bring him back but here, it's just a gesture.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Zoo dollars?

utterance.speaker: LIPSON
utterance.content: Yes, and come see the bird show at 4. The macaws wear hats. Well it's a lot cuter if your monkey hasn't just died.

utterance.speaker: KIDS
utterance.content: Ooohhh.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I can't believe Joey's having lunch with his stalker. What i-, what is she like.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, you remember Cathy Bates in Misery?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL AND MONICA
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, she looks the exact opposite of that.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: And she's not crazy?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh no no no, she's a total wack job. Yeah, she thinks that Joey is actually Dr. Drake Remore.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ah, and I mean, he's going out with her? He can not persue this.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey, just because this woman thinks she can actually see Joey through the magical box in her living room doesn't mean she's not a person. I mean, does she not deserve happiness, does she not deserve love? What're you lookin' at me for? He's the one who wants to boff the maniac.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: You OK?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No, uh-uh, I'm just, I'm nervous. So, you know what, maybe if I just, if I picture them all in their underwear.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: That's not a good idea, that's kinda the reason the last guy got fired.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I'm just, I'm, I'm, I'm used to playing for grown-ups. Ya know, they just, grown-ups drink their coffee and do their grown-up thing, ya know, and kids listen. This is a huge responsibility. What? Are you gonna kiss me?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I was thinkin' about it.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK. OK, alrighty, let's play some tunes. Hi everybody, I'm Phoebe

utterance.speaker: ALL
utterance.content: Hi Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, um, I'm gonna play, um, some songs about grandparents, OK. Now, grandma's a person who everyone likes,

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: Oh, Drake, isn't it amazing?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah it is. . . what?

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: Well, here we sit, devil may care, just a little while ago you were reattaching someone's spinal cord.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, that was a tricky one. In reality, that operation takes like, over 10 hours, but they only showed it for 2 minites.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: Who's they?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No one.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: Oh Drake, you are so talented, let me see those hands. Oh these hands, these beautiful hands, oh I could just eat them. . . but I won't.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Good, otherwise my watch would fall off.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: No, seriously. These hands. These miracle, magical, life-giving hands. Oh, just to be near them, touch them, maybe even lick one?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Alright, just one. Wow, you're good at that.

utterance.speaker: WAITER
utterance.content: Oh my God! Someone, he's choking. Is anyone here a doctor?

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: Well, yes, yes, the best doctor in all of Salem, Dr. Drake Remore.

utterance.speaker: JANITOR
utterance.content: Meet me in the nocturnal house in 15 minutes.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Uhh, hey look, I don't really enjoy being with other men that way. But, um, zoo dollars?

utterance.speaker: JANITOR
utterance.content: It's about your monkey. It's alive.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: I don't understand, why didn't you help that man?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Uhh, cause, uhh, I'm a neurosurgeon and that was clearly a case of, uh, uh, foodal chokage. Alright, look, I got to tell you something.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: No, no no no, you don't have to tell me anything. You don't have to explain yourself to me. Ooh, who am I to question the great Dr. Drake Remore?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: But that's what...

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: I should just be happy to be near you.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey I-

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: Hey what?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: That's it, just hey. Like at the end of a dance, HEY! Hey. He-hey.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: There'll be times when you get older

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Excellent!

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Very informative!

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Not at all inappropriate!

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Thank you for coming everybody. There're cookies in the back.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: That was great, the kids loved you.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yay, I rock.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: And you know why? Because you told the truth, and nobody ever tells kids the truth.You were incredible.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: But.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: How did you know there was a but?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I sense these things. It was either but or butter.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: The thing is, I think some of the parents, they were kinda hopin' that you'd play more songs about like, barnyard animals.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I can do that.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Because that would be fantastic. What? You wanna kiss me?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Thinkin' about it.

utterance.speaker: JANITOR
utterance.content: Ahh, the bat. Ambassador of darkness, flitting out of his cave like a winged messenger, sightless spectre of the macabe.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Buddy, my monkey?

utterance.speaker: JANITOR
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, right. There was a break-in, few months back, inside job. Your monkey was taken.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh my God. But the zoo told me that my monkey was dead.

utterance.speaker: JANITOR
utterance.content: The zoo! Do you believe everything the zoo tells ya?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: That, that's the only thing the zoo's ever told me.

utterance.speaker: JANITOR
utterance.content: Of course they're gonna say he's dead. They don't want the bad publicity. It's all a great big cover-up. Do you have any idea how high up this thing goes?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: That guy Lipson?

utterance.speaker: JANITOR
utterance.content: Lipson knows. Do you have any idea who else knows?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No, I, I only know Lipson.

utterance.speaker: JANITOR
utterance.content: Hmm, Lipson knows huh? Ahh, hello Mr. Opossum, enigma of the trees, upside-down denizen of the night, taunting gravity with...

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Buddy, my monkey, my monkey.

utterance.speaker: JANITOR
utterance.content: Word on the street - well, when I say street, I mean those little pretend streets they have here at the zoo.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: JANITOR
utterance.content: Your monkey found a new career, in the entertainment field. That's all I know.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: This is unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: JANITOR
utterance.content: So, what is this information worth to you, my friend?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Are you trying to get me to bribe you?

utterance.speaker: JANITOR
utterance.content: Maybe.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: But you already told me everything.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Check it out, he actually is the MonkeyShine monkey.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well, so what're you gonna do?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, I guess I'm gonna call the beer company and try to find out where he is.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: That's what I did when I lost my Clydesdales.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: OK, hi again.

utterance.speaker: ALL
utterance.content: Hi Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Today we're gonna start with some songs about barnyard animals. Oh, the cow in the meadow goes moo,

utterance.speaker: TV DOCTOR
utterance.content: You're the only one who can save her Drake.

utterance.speaker: JOEY ON TV
utterance.content: Damnit, I'm a doctor, I'm not God.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, there goes my whole belief system.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: It's Erica.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh my God, quick turn off the TV.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No no no, wait, I wanna see what happens.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Uh, I get Leslie out of the coma and then we make out.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well how can that be, you were just kissing Sabrina?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Rachel, it's a world where Joey is a neuro-surgeon.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey Erica, c'mon in.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: How did you get here so fast, I just saw you in Salem?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Right, they uh, they choppered me in. What's up?

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: Ohh, and I see you're having a little party too. Is she here, huh, huh?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: Sabrina. I know about you two. I saw you today kissing in the doctor's lounge.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: It's not what you think, that was...

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: You told me I was the only one.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Alright look, that's it. I don't think we should see each other anymore, alright. Look, I know I should have told you this a long time ago but I am not Drake Remore, OK. I'm not even a doctor, I'm an actor. I just pretend to be a doctor.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: Oh my God. Do the people at the hospital know about this?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Somebody wanna help me out here?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, I know, I know.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: How, how can you be here and there.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: 'Cause it's a television show.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: Drake, what're you getting at?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I'm not Drake.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: That's right, he's not Drake, he's Hans Remore, Drake's evil twin.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: Is this true?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yes, yes it is true. And I know this because, because he pretended to be Drake to, to sleep with me.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: And then he told me he would run away with me, and he didn't.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: And you left the toilet seat up, you bastard.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: Is all this true?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yes, I'm afraid it is. You deserve much better than me Erica. You deserve to be with the real Drake, he's the one you fell in love with. Go to Salem, find him, he's the guy for you.

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: Oh Hans.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hans...Hans...Yo evil twin.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Right. Goodbye Erica, good luck in Salem. Take care

utterance.speaker: ERICA
utterance.content: I'll never forget you Hans.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: OK, alright, the people who threw the water.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Fired! Why?

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: The library board has had a lot of complaints from parents about some of the stuff in your songs.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I can't believe it. Did you tell your board about how kids want to hear the truth?

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I see.

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: Maybe if you just played some regular kiddie songs.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No. What do you, what do you want me to be, like some stupid, big, like, purple dinosaur?

utterance.speaker: ROB
utterance.content: I'm not saying you have to be Barney.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Who's Barney.
